alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:25PM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Greenville. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 721 PM EST, Rain gauge reports indicated that recent heavy rainfall produced 3 to 5 inches of rain across the area. Elevated water levels will continue through late evening and into the early overnight, especially along larger streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Welcome, Donaldson Center, Cherrydale Point, Fork Shoals and Princeton. - Flooding is most likely along the Enoree River at Pelham, with flooding expected along Gibb Shoals Road. Additional flooding will continue along Gilder Creek at East Georgia Road as well as along the Reedy River channel from Greenville to Highway 418. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
